110592.name: Lomodo IVa
110592.description:
From the Introduction:

LOMODO IVa is another adventure Approved For Use With Traveller™. The following is a description of the world, LOMODO IVa, located Theta Borealis Sector of the Imperium.

The referee should feel free to add to or delete and he wishes; and remember, role-playing is free form, so have fun!

LOMODO IVa uses Basic Traveller with references to Mercenary and High Guard.

User summary:

The setting is non-canon. Includes a large full color world hex map.

110593.name: Marinagua
110593.description:
From the Introduction:

This playaid describes the planet Marinagua. It is Approved For Use With Traveller™.

Covered in the following pages are Marinagua's terrain types, flora, fauna, race, the Invincible Bastion, the Palace of Wealth and the capital city, Balac Pont. Three pages of encounter charts and sketches of the race and fauna are added for your playing enjoyment.

User summary:

The setting is non-canon. Includes a large full color world hex map.

110594.name: Sapies
110594.description:
From the Introduction:

SAPIES is a world adventure, APPROVED FOR USE WITH TRAVELLER. The planet is located in the Banderhue Quadrant, Theta Borealis Sector of the Imperium. The original concept and majority of design is by Dorothy Bledsaw.

User summary:

The setting is non-canon. Includes a large full color world hex map.

110595.name: Republic: The Revolution
videogamehonor: 2001 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
2002 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
110595.description:
Republic: The Revolution is a depiction of grassroots political action, where one attempts to put their preferred government in power. It is set in Novistrana, a small, fictional, post-Soviet country in Eastern Europe.

The game is divided into Days, each of which is a cycle of a Morning, Afternoon, and Night. Each of these periods is a turn of sorts, in which orders may be given to faction members to be carried out in the next available turn, and every morning resources (Force, Influence and Wealth) are collected.

Source: Wikipedia, "Republic: The Revolution", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

110597.name: Shangri-La, PigWars Expansion Module #2
110597.description:
Shangri-La is the second expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty.

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

110598.description:
In Isegrim, players are trying to collect a certain set of cards in order to win – but they don't even necessarily know what they're holding!

The deck in Isegrim consists of fifty double-sided cards, with each side of a card showing one of five animals in one of five landscapes. Each player starts the game with seven cards in hand, with a circle of fifteen cards laid out in a circle on the table. Players then exchange cards based on questions and answers between one another, trying to lead others down false paths while collecting the cards one needs in order to win.
110598.name: Isegrim

110599.name: PondWars, PigWars Expansion Module #3
110599.description:
PondWars is the third expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty. Some additional rules.

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

110600.name: Asuang: Shapechanging Horrors
110600.description:
From publisher blurb:

A malevolent hunger stirs in the dark corners of the woods. With their inhuman forms they crawl, they fly, and they leap; inching closer toward the sound of the rolling ocean waves, toward the town and its lively chorus. You stop as you sense their otherworldly eyes watching you, their tongues longing for the taste of your entrails. You brace yourself as they step out of the darkness - and are surprised to see that they can wear a human form just like you.

Asuang: Shapechanging Horrors is an illustrated, 18-page product that showcases some of the iconic monsters of Philippine folklore. It tackles the different stories common folk tell regarding these creatures, as well as storytelling themes that a gamemaster can use to integrate these creatures into any campaign. Intended for the 4th Edition of the Dungeons and Dragons game, this product presents eight new monsters ranging from levels 4 to 18 - all in a new, updated statblock format. Some of these monsters include:

The tianak: Undead creatures created from unborn children infused with an asuang's blood.
The sigbin: Shadowborn asuangs that can assume the form of misshapen black hounds.
The manananggal: Malevolent spellcasters who sprout wings and segment their torsos to fly off into the night to hunt prey.




This product also contains a GM toolkit with asuang encounters, as well as thematic storytelling and game elements that a gamemaster can add to existing monsters to provide an "asuang feel."

110601.name: The Slaughterhouse, PigWars Expansion Module #4
110601.description:
The Slaughterhouse is the fourth expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty. Some additional rules.

The theme of the expansion is the horrors of that dreadful place that all young piglings fear the most; the horrors of the slaughterhouse...

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

110602.name: Tikbalang: Guardians of Kalikasan
110602.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Buan Campaign Setting starts here! Explore Kalupaan with the Tikbalang, one of the most iconic creatures of Philippine Mythology. These feyborn creatures bear an affinity with the winds, and they protect the gateways leading to the fey realms with the subtlety of the breeze and the fury of the cyclone.
Tikbalang: Guardians of Kalikasan presents the players with a new character race - their motivations and culture, as well as the myths other races have regarding them.Game masters are likewise presented with three new tikbalang monsters, all at the lower paragon tier, as well as a skill challenge that can make for a memorable tikbalang encounter.
This 13-page product includes the following:

A fully playable character race that favors the barbarian, paladin, and warlock classes
Nine tikbalang feats
Two racial paragon paths
Three new monsters
An optional skill challenge for dealing with the tikbalangs
Two new rituals that are thematically linked with the tikbalang race

110603.name: The Blizzard, PigWars Expansion Module #5
110603.description:
The Blizzard is the fifth expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty. Some additional rules.

Snow has fallen in the sty, and the theme for this expansion is winter, but the battles in the sty is just as fierce and heated as always...

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

110604.name: Splade
110604.description:
Splade is an evolution of Spline for 3 players that can be played with a Shibumi set. It uses a 4x4 holes board and spheres in 3 colors (white, black and red). It was inspired by the great Gute Nachbarn, by Alex Randolph.

How to play:

The board (n×n) starts empty.

Starting with white (then black and red), players take turns placing a marble of their colour on an empty space or platform (2×2 arrangement of marbles).

Whenever a full line with exactly 2 colors is formed, the game ends. The winner is the player with a color in that line whose position in the player order is immediately before the other player with a color in that line.

This is, for a 4×4 set, a 4-in-a-row on the first layer, or a 3-in-a-row on the 2nd layer, or a 2-in-a-row on the 3rd layer.

Example:

White makes a line of 3 on the second layer containing 2 white balls and one black ball and wins.

Variant:

Consider the colour of the previous player instead of the next.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

110605.name: A fistful of truffles, PigWars Expansion Module #6
110605.description:
A fistful of truffles is the sixth expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty.

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

110606.name: Return of the BBQ king, PigWars Expansion Module #7
110606.description:
Return of the BBQ King is the seventh expansion module to PigWars.

It contains additional cards and pigsty.

The main game, PigWars, is needed to play this expansion.

110607.name: Empire of the Ghouls
110607.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep below the earth, in caverns lightless and unknown to man, live our nightmares: the spidery drow, the wild alien mind shredders and intellect devourers, and worst of all, the insatiable ghouls in their cities and empires.

This Open Design project created a fully-detailed underdark society of civilized ghouls. This includes some description of their gods, slaves, templates, new monsters, and unique magic, and then sets up all those elements within a multi-level adventure for roughly 9th to 12th level. The final result is a 160-page page adventure unlike any other, with lethal and new challenges for any experienced party.

Fully-mapped ghoul empire and underdark cities
More than 80 playtested encounters, many with tactical maps
A ghoul prestige class, the Imperial Hunter
Ghoul magic and items unique to the Imperium
And 8 new deadly monsters!

110608.name: Halls of the Mountain-King (4E Version)
110608.description:
From publisher blurb:

Halls of the Mountain-King is an untraditional dungeon, an homage to all the great delves, from the Mines of Moria on — with a few new twists.

The dwarves of the canton of Rygar were a hard-working group, whose mining lured them ever-deeper and whose pursuit of ore led them into dangerous territory. This dungeon goes from a snowy mountaintop spire and an airship dock down through the great halls and works of a vanished clan, and into the depths of the earth.

The rumors of a huge mass of gold lured miners and speculators into the mountain, but when winter came, the old mines were suddenly a much more difficult place to survive. The passes are
snowed in. The airships struggle to arrive with supplies.

Deadly new creatures, a sinister brotherhood, and secrets kept
locked away for centuries all boil to the surface in a series of challenging and original encounters that take the party from 8th to 12th level.

Now the party is asked to go up into the Ironcrag peaks and see whether the easy money is, perhaps, not so easy aft er all.

110609.name: Double Panda
110609.description:
User Summary

Control two pandas, each with special powers. You will need to switch between them to get through each level, making use of their abilities to maximize score and proceed. The game has an 8-bit feel and is set in an Eastern atmosphere.

110610.name: Drunken Masters
110610.description:
User Summary

You are a bartender serving patrons drinks at a club. You can serve drinks with flair to increase your tips, doing things like flipping a bottle in the air. You must act quickly though, if you make them wait too long for their drinks, they will get mad and leave. Breaking bottles is also not recommended. Choose from several bartenders with different skills (which can be upgraded), and different special abilities.

110611.name: Dragon Slayer (Issue 19)
110611.description:
Table of Contents

2 - Bard's News
6 - Reviews Complete Arcana, Monstronomicon, Vampire Requiem
10 - Have you played? Street Fighter RPG
14 - Special RPG in Japan
16 - Background
18 - Dungeon Master
20 - Against Arsenal
24 - Realms's News Tormenta
26 - Boss Alien or Predator?
28 - Naruto Advanced Techniques for Ninjas
36 - Animal Men
44 - Iron Realms
48 - Race & Class
54 - Comics Dragon's Bride

110612.name: Living Constructs
110612.description:
From publisher blurb:

Golems make excellent servants, tireless, tough and obedient, but they lack that spark of life and adaptability that free thinking people have. Some have tried to instil their creations with some imitation of the free though, the soul, that ‘real’ people have with varying degrees of success and sometimes spectacular failure. When a slave has the ability to recognise that it is a slave it chafes against that control and seeks to free itself from it. Some of those constructs have managed to win their freedom through violence, labour, the death of their creator or their largesse and these constructs have gained true freedom, true self determination and true souls, becoming complete. Now these freed slaves form an ever growing community of liberated beings and they are learning to make more of themselves.

Living Constructs provides the opportunity to play self-determining devices, golems and constructs in D&D4E campaigns and game worlds.

110613.name: Wyrmstone: Almanac TY109
110613.description:
From publisher blurb:

High sailing adventure returns in this exciting setting designed for community driven organized play using the hot new Fantasy Craft rules! Can also be played at home or with other die 20 style game systems including Pathfinder and D&D!

This first Almanac helps establish the vast canvass of Wyrmstone.

110614.name: Wyrmstone: Idols of Ogun-Samdi
110614.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can you retrieve the rumored golden idols of Ogun-Samdi, feared Falo dual-headed god of secrets? This is a fast-play introductory module to the Wyrmstone Setting, and is designed to be played on 2-3 hours. It is written for use with Fantasycraft, but is easily adapted to any die 20 game system including D&D and Pathfinder.

110615.name: Wyrmstone: The Lost Prince
110615.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nearly three centuries ago, when the Crown Prince of Vevonne disappeared on a quest to slay a demon, everyone presumed the worst. New information concerning his final resting place has come to light. Are you up to the task to follow this new lead and possibly return his remains to the crown?
This is a Gold Adventure module to the Wyrmstone Setting, and is designed to be played on 3-8 hours. Includes 3 maps and 6 pages of player handounts. This adventure is written for use with Fantasycraft, but is easily adapted to any other die 20 systems including D&D and Pathfinder.

110616.name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers (Genesis)
110616.description:
User Summary

Unlike its SNES counterpart, which was a fighting game, the Mighty Morphin Power Rangers game on Sega Genesis was a fighting game. The player chooses between one of the five original Power Rangers and fights a one-on-one battle against Rita Repulsa's latest monster. Victory in the one-on-one results in a battle between Megazord and a giant version of that same monster. After a certain point in the game when you have defeated the Green Ranger and his Dragonzord, you have the option of playing as the Green Ranger and his Dragonzord. Each Power Ranger has some standard fighting game moves and a couple of special moves. Both zords have different moves and all of the monsters in the game have different moves that they will throw at the player.

110617.name: Garanimals ABC Games
110617.description:
Garanimals ABC Games comes with 52 letter/picture game tiles and a double sided board with two ways to play. Each tile has a letter on one side and a corresponding picture on the other.

A-Z Picture Match is played by turning all the tiles picture side up. Players take turns selecting a tile, guessing what letter the picture starts with, and placing the tile on the correct letter on the game board.

Turning Letters Into Words is played by matching the letter tiles to make words on the game board.

110618.name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers (Sega CD)
110618.description:
User Summary

The Sega CD edition of Mighty Morphin Power Rangers is a full-motion video game where the player watches actual footage from the TV show and presses buttons at the appropriate moment to minimize damage. To survive the round and continue to receive video feed, the player must keep their characters alive through lightning-fast button presses. The game features slightly truncated footage from several of the early episodes.

110619.name: The Too Much Coffee Role Playing System
rpg: The Too Much Coffee Role Playing System
110619.description:
User Summary
The TMCRPS is a flexible system with a simple twist. Players may be rewarded with 'coffee beans' for role playing well, achieving a goal, or whatever the GM feels worth rewarding.

The other rules create a simple system based on d6s. It is tended toward a medieval theme but could easily be adapted for any theme.

110620.name: Secrets of the Alchemist
110620.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Secrets of the Alchemist gives you insight into the alchemist class and the tools to make an exciting character that is a "blast" to play. Created by Sigfried Trent, this 12-page book includes:

A breakdown of the Alchemist class from the Advanced Player's Guide
30 new feats for alchemists, such as Bottoms Up, Fire in the Hole, Primeval Fury, and Sundering Bomb
Alchemist character builds: The Carpet Bomber, Mighty Mutant, and Mad Scientist!




When the goblin chief asks you what's in all those funny bottles hanging from your belt, uncork a laboratory full of whoop-ass on him!

110621.name: The Cavalier's Creed
110621.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cavalier's Creed rides forth to battle with an array of new feats for the knightly cavalier and his faithful steed!

Created by Sigfried Trent, this 16-page book includes:

A short breakdown of the Cavalier class
30 new feats for the Cavalier including Back to Back, Move as One, and Size Doesn't Matter
3 Cavalier character builds: the Green Knight, Tawny Knight, and Black Knight




Take arms and prepare for battle with Advanced Feats: The Cavalier's Creed today!

110622.name: The Inquisitor's Edge
110622.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Inquisitor's Edge equips this new class to go forth and kick tail for the gods! The inquisitor is incredibly well rounded with strong combat potential, an arsenal of skill options, and a versatile selection of spells. This volume of the Advanced Feats series gives players plenty of options that take advantage of the inquisitor's unique strengths to create an effective and memorable character for any campaign.Created by Sigfried Trent, this 16-page book includes:

A breakdown of the inquisitor class
30 new feats for inquisitors including Shared Judgment, Misdirected Strike and Track Spirits
Three full inquisitor character builds: Bloodhound, Wolf in Sheep's Clothing and Detective




Arm thyself against the Dark with Advanced Feats: The Inquisitor's Edge today!

110623.name: The Summoner's Circle
110623.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Summoner's Circle conjures forth a slavering horde of new feats and behind-the-screen insights into the most complicated and inspired new class in the Pathfinder line up.

Created by Sigfried Trent, this 19-page book includes:

A breakdown of the summoner class
30 new feats for summoners including Cannibalistic Casting, Giant Step, and Unstable Evolutions
A complete character sheet for your summoner's eidolon




Summoner character builds: chess master, mythic rider, and master of arms
Bring out your wild side and summon forth the fun with Advanced Feats: The Summoner's Circle today!

110624.name: Visions of the Oracle
rpgissuearticle: Advanced Feats: Visions of the Oracle
110624.description:
From publisher blurb:

Continuing the popular Advanced Feats series, Visions of the Oracle takes a deeper look at this spontaneous divine class and offers 30 game-tested feats, 3 rock-solid chaaracter builds, plus a class overview, analysis, and designer commentary.

Created by Sigfried Trent, this 17-page book includes:

A short breakdown of the Oracle class
30 new feats for the Oracle including Conditional Curse, Meta Spell, and Wand Casting
Oracle character builds: Visionary Healer, Phoenix, Savage Seer




Prepare for a prosperous future by consulting with Advanced Feats: Visions of the Oracle today!

110625.name: Might of the Magus
110625.description:
From publisher blurb:

Might of the Magus brings you feats of swordsmanship and spellcraft, expanding the range of this already versatile class.

Created by Complete Advanced Feats author Sigfried Trent, this 16-page book includes:

An insightful breakdown of the magus class
30 new feats for the Magus including Adrenalin Surge, Dancing Strike, and Spellstrike Multishot
3 Magus character builds: The Fae Blade, Lady of the Lash, and The Rune Fist




Get ready to do it all with Advanced Feats: Might of the Magus today!

110626.name: Advanced Class: Sorcerer – Aberrant Blood
110626.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some sorcerers are blessed with a draconic heritage. Others wield the ambivalent force of chaotic wild magic. If only you were as lucky as these. Your blood runs a sickly purple-black with the presence of an aberration. Perhaps a tentacled fiend was one of your parents or further ancestors; or maybe you were experimented upon as a newborn by deranged and devious minds from the forces of the farthest realm. In any case, this cursed inheritance grants you the ability to wield powerful arcane powers . . . but is it worth having such a twisted form, such as to be nigh unrecognizable from others of your race?

The next title from the Advanced Class line is the 'Aberrant Blood' installment for the sorcerer. While some gain their power from innate bonds to chaos magic, or draconic heritage, the aberrant blood sorcerer has the unfortunate presence of Far Realm corruption in his ancestry. Grow tentacles, open gibbering mouths all across your body, and grow beholder stalk eyes with this new sorcerer class feature and its powers.

110627.name: Advanced Class: Druid – Favored Forms
110627.description:
From publisher blurb:

As a druid, you have the power to adopt the shape of any natural or fey beast found across the planes or your imagination. However, in all your time dwelling in the wilds, you have grown attached to one particular shape; you have developed a kinship with one species of beast that your fellow druids, in their ever-shifting wild forms, cannot understand or respect. They speak of the advantages of versatility—but you have delved into the nature of your favored form and claimed its strength as part of your own.

Favored Forms, the first installment of the Advanced Class line from Silent7Seven Games, includes seven heroic feats and four paragon feats that allow your druid character to truly manifest the form of your favorite animal or magical beast. The heroic feats grant you animal abilites available only in that shape, and the paragon tier feats take it a step further, granting you access to special powers that tap into the inherent powers of your favored form.

110628.name: Huxtropy
110628.description:
From publisher blurb:

Long ago, a trickster gypsy named Felavusix fooled four powerful entities from the Elemental Chaos into an endless game of cards. Having trapped them, he enacted a ritual to draw their elemental power into his own cards. Learn to wield the huxtropy deck as an arcane implement, or as a weapon using an actual deck of cards for damage (instead of dice!)

With feats, a ranger reskin known as the deckslinger, the gamblers pact warlock, and a new paragon path, Huxtropy includes everything you need to play a card-wielding character. You'll also find backstory for the elemental gamblers, rules to play the actual gambling game of huxtropy, how to read a fortune with a huxtropy deck, and more.

110629.name: Garnering the Cult's Favor
110629.description:
From publisher blurb:

For as long as anyone can remember, a dark cult has plagued the land. Its members gather at night in carnivals of flesh; they perform dark rituals and carnal acts in orgies of necrosis and blood. They have been tolerated.

Recently, a faction of the cult has splintered off. This splintered faction has begun unfiltered killing throughout the city. In order to learn the origin of the splinter faction, the PCs must infiltrate them.

This is a free skill challenge for a group of level 6 players characters. They must pretend to aid as the splinter faction slaughters a group of the original cultists; they must make it look like they're helping to gain the cult faction's favor without getting any blood on their own hands.

110630.name: Rune Jump-Start Rules
110630.description:
from the introduction:

A Hero is Made

As an experienced roleplayer, you may be expecting the typical arrangement whereby each player chooses from an array of very different, but complementary, character types. Forget that errant non-sense! Here we will all play stout and well-armored warriors, our abilities all honed in the forge ofbloody combat! Warriors, we say! Warriors, warriors, warriors!

User comment:
A set of quick-start rules for the Rune RPG.

videogame: Neverwinter Nights: Hordes of the Underdark
110631.name: Neverwinter Nights: Platinum
videogamecompilation: Neverwinter Nights: Hordes of the Underdark
110631.description:
User Summary

Neverwinter Nights Platinum Edition includes the original Neverwinter Nights, and both official expansion packs: Neverwinter Nights: Shadows of Undrentide and Neverwinter Nights: Hordes of the Underdark and all game enhancements and updates.

110632.name: Noah's Ark game Two by Two
110632.description:
Noah's Ark game Two by Two. It's up to you to save the animals! There's no age limit on fun with this family game that tells the story of Noah's faith and reinforces his long-ago mission to do God's will. First you must gather the animals into the ark! Then you must journey through the treacherous waters and land safely on Mt. Ararat! The journney is filled with perils- and rewards, too! Beware of the lightening bolt! Be thankful for a Rainbow! The game casts each player in the roles of Noah and his family. Play the PRECIOUS MOMENTS Noah's Ark game with family and friends.

Each player take an ark card and a characture playing piece. As players travel the game they will recreate the story of Noah and the Ark and collect animals as they go. Spin the spinner and move clockwise around the outer path of the game board. As a plyer lands of a colored space, the player may collect the animal associated with that color and place it on their ark card. A player landing on a sun space can collect any animal. Play continues until a player collects all 8 animals (2 of each kind), and immediately move back to start.

If during the game a player lands on a lightening bolt he must move 3 spaces back. Any player reaching start withou all 8 animals, must go around the outside of the board and continue until all 8 animals are collected.

Once a player has all of the animals and has moved back to start, he will spin and move along the inner trail. This path follows Noah's trip across the raging water. It is filled with perils just like Noah's journey. When the player reaches Mt. Ararat, he continues in turn to spin the spinner and unload his ark based on the number spun. When all of a player's animals are unloaded, the player contiunes to spin in turn and help others unload their animals.

110633.name: Profiles The Biography Guessing Game
110633.description: The Biography Guessing Game. Spend some time with some famous people! Profiles is the new game that gets you up close and personal with 500 of the most famous people from the past and the present! Listen to the catagory, decide whether you want multiple choice, then hear the question. Score one point when you answer correct using multiple choice, three points when you answer correct all on your own. Reach the finish line first and win the game. But watch out! Pitfalls await you along the way to make your Biography Quest even more challenging!

110634.name: Tiny Heroes
110634.description:
Tiny Heroes is a dungeon defense game for the iPhone and iPod Touch where you play as the dungeon, protecting your treasure from oncoming waves of Heroes… who are tiny.

Source: The Game Website.

110635.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The new Dust Tactics: Axis Hero Pack allows players to guide their Axis Zombie units with one (or both) of two new Heroes with the Blutkreuz Zombie skill.

Shrugging off small arms fire with his Damage Resilient skill, Grenadier X flings himself into Close combat with his circular saw where he cuts into troops and walkers indiscriminately. Any Allied forces that don't fall to Grenadier X and any zombie squad he joins may find themselves concerned by the sinister presence of TotenMeister. Not only did this Blutkreuz Korps experiment manage to cheat death and become both Damage Resilient and ferociously strong, but her supply of Wiederbelebungsserum allows her to recover from nearly any wound. With their unholy strength, these Heroes lend resilience to any Axis army, with or without squads of Axis Zombies to join them.

Additionally, the Axis Hero Pack introduces Stefan, a deadly Oberleutnant who uses some of the Allies' most effective tricks against them, literally fighting fire with fire with his Flammenwerfer 40.
110635.name: Dust Tactics: Axis Hero Pack – "Stefan / Totenmeister / Grenadier X"

110636.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Though they each come from different backgrounds and though they each pursue their own methods, the famous warriors of the Dust Tactics: Allies Hero Pack all share a talent for wiping out Axis units. (Action Jackson and Johnny One-Eye were previously released in a limited manner through FFG's Game Night Kits.)

Action Jackson drops onto the battlefield as a British paratrooper, armored in a high-tech ASOCOM battle suit and equipped with two 60W Phaser Guns. Phaser technology may still be new, but when it all comes together, Action Jackson can blast through even the heaviest Axis walkers in a single instant. Meanwhile, The Priest prefers to operate up close and personal, where he's a sly expert with his dynamite charges, and Johnny One-Eye may not be the first badass to walk the Dust Tactics battlefields, but he's the first Hero with the skill to prove it. His Badass skill means he's not the type of guy who likes running out of ammunition while Axis forces close in around him. Johnny One-Eye and any squad he joins gain unlimited uses of their limited ammunition weapons.
110636.name: Dust Tactics: Allies Hero Pack – "Action Jackson / The Priest / Johnny One-Eye"

110637.name: Le Florilège du Jet Prismatique Excellent: Volume I
110637.description:
An anthology of scenarii from the periodical The Excellent Prismatic Spray

Introduction
Crédits et sommaire
Chapitre I : "Les Mermelants s'unissent" par Thomas Russel (translated by Célia Schneebeli)
Chapitre II : "Zarmanth" par David Thomas (translated by Michaël Zamo)
Chapitre III: "Les Phasmes" par Robin D. Laws (translated by Célia Schneebeli)
Chapitres IV : "Lumarth & La Caravane d'Aktabras" par Ian Thomson (translated by Célia Schneebeli)

110638.name: Le Florilège du Jet Prismatique Excellent: Volume II
110638.description:
An anthology of scenarii and play aid from the periodical The Excellent Prismatic Spray (+1 original French version)

Introduction
Crédits et sommaire
Chapitre I : "Nouveaux Amedements" par Sasha Bilton & Phil Masters
Chapitre II : "Port de Forell" par Lizard
Chapitre III : "Cultes et Cabales de la Vieille Terre" par Lizard
Chapitre IV "L'Enfer Vert" by Ian Thomson & Lizard
Chapitre V "Efred, la Cité-Sanctuaire" par David Thomas
Chapitre VI "le Collège de l'Infinie Sagesse de Twanlik l'Omniscient" par Virgile Malaquin (Exclusive French material).

110639.name: Pictureka!
110639.description:
User Summary

Fast paced find the objects game based on the board game of the same name. Pictureka!

Career mode has you travel across a series of islands completing seek-and-find missions before time runs out.

110640.name: Clue: Secrets & Spies
110640.description:
User Summary

A hidden object game that shares little more with the original Clue board game than the title. In this version CLUE is an anagram for Criminal League for Ultimate Espionage who has to be stopped by your ability to find hidden objects.

110641.name: Schatzinsel Ahoi!
110641.description:
Schatzinsel Ahoi! is an easy treasure hunting game for children with a memory element. The board is a grid of 36 squares, each showing a symbol / detail. A gold coin is placed on one of the squares.
There are 36 face-down tiles, each corresponding to a square on the board. Players reveal one tile, and if it fits a square adjacent to the own pirate, they can move there. Than the tile is turned face down again. The first player to reach the gold coin is the winner.

110642.name: Rise of Immortals
110642.description:
"Rise of Immortals is an online, free-to-play PC game that expands on the hit Multiplayer Online Battle Arena (MOBA) genre with new, innovative features designed to appeal to both core and casual players.

Rise of Immortals is set in the world of Graxia, 300 years after the events of “Guardians of Graxia,” Petroglyph’s fantasy-based PC game released last year. Rise of Immortals features the popular action-strategy gameplay of traditional MOBA games, but adds enhanced socialization features, along with persistent character progression – a first for the MOBA genre. Instead of an account- based leveling system, players can advance their Immortals through a diverse, persistent skill tree, customizing and upgrading the characters to unlock unique abilities that persist from match to match.

In addition, Rise of Immortals features a social hub where players can show off their enhanced Immortals, chat, emote, browse leaderboards, shop, manage friend and guild lists and more. Players also have the option of taking their Immortals through cooperative Player versus Environment (PvE) scenarios to learn the game, try out new abilities, and earn persistent experience before jumping into Player versus Player (PvP) matches online."

Source: The Game Website.

110643.description:
Le Retour de l'Empereur is a game on four battles of 1815: Quatre Bras, Ligny, Waterloo and Wavre, using the Vive l'Empereur game system.

"Vive l’Empereur!" is a series of simulation games using a standard rules system and a set of exclusive rules specific to each battle. These particular rules include an historical commentary and the victory conditions for each scenario. The aim of this system is to refight at the regimental scale the numerous battles fought during the Napoleonic Era in Europe, between 1805 and 1815. It uses a map on which the players move counters representing the combat units involved in these battles.

The present game simulates battles of the campaign of 1815 in Belgium that belongs to the legend. After he returns from Elba, Napoléon reconstructed an army and landed a preventive strike on the two closest armies, the Prussian army under the old and faithful Blücher, and the Anglo-Allied army under the Duke of Wellington. At first spread over a vast area, these two armies eventually assembled and fought four legendary battles at Quatre Bras and Ligny on the 16th of June, and then two days later at Wavre and of course Waterloo, called Mont St Jean by the French, and La Belle Alliance by the Prussians. This campaign is an impressive collection of missed opportunities on both sides. Now it is your turn to do at least as well, or better...

Components:

- six 22" x 34" maps (scale 250m/hex)
- 600 counters, including 300 combat units
- 2 rules booklets: the Standard Rules Version 3 and the special rules
- 10 charts and tables, including army losses
- more than 30 scenarios and what-ifs, including a 3-day campaing game
110643.name: Le Retour de l'Empereur

110644.name: Wolfschanze
110644.description:
User Summary

Wolfschanze is a first person shooter. Play as a German colonel during World War II and try to eliminate Hitler to bring down the Nazi regime and end the war. The game is loosely based on the life of Claus Schenk von Stauffenberg.

110645.name: Iddy Umpty
110645.description:
The New Wireless Card Game - Quickly teaches you to read Morse.

This is an older person's Snap variant. During the game you need to alike images and you need to know the Morse Code name for the letter (if that letter has a name identity). I think it probably dates from the 20's.

The winner is the one who ends up with all the cards.

The name was not made up by the publisher. It sounds as if it comes from a children's nursery rhyme, but it is the "conventional verbal representation of the dots and dashes of the Morse code" according to the OED. Troops were apparently taught to recognise whether a dot or a dash was being transmitted by the sound of the machine. A dot made an 'iddy' sound and a dash sounded like 'umpty'.

110646.name: Wolfschanze II
110646.description:
User Summary

Wolfschanze II is a first person shooter. Play a Russian army officer in World War II. You attack a German stronghold in order to steal an encrypting machine and its code book.

110647.name: Tropico 3: Absolute Power
110647.description:
In March 2010, the Tripico 3 expansion pack "Absolute Power" was announced, slated for release in Europe in 2010.

The expansion received an 8/10 on Game Zone, closing with "Absolute Power isn’t a revolution, instead taking the framework laid out by the original game and building on it with new features and a wacky new campaign. The core mechanics are still the same, and the new campaign might be a turn off to sim fans looking for something more grounded and traditional. However, if you were a fan of Tropico 3 and want another reason to step into the role of El Presidente once more, then this is your chance." Absolute Power was only released on PC.

The expansion pack gives the player a wider selection of edicts such as 'Print money', 'Free housing', 'Delete a Faction' and 'Shoot Juanito' (which involves blowing up Juanito's TNT Radio). These new edicts are called 'Megalomania edicts', for each edict that the player releases they can gain a varying amount of megalomania score that counts at the end of the game. Also there is a new range of buildings, including 'Golden Statue' (in the likeness of 'El Presidente'), 'Garbage dump' and 'Balloon rides'. The Loyalist faction is also introduced; it is composed of the player's most loyal supporters. There is also a second radio DJ named Betty Boom who is head of the resistance movement against el Presidente.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tropico 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

110648.name: Tropico 3: Gold Edition
110648.description:
User Summary

A compilation of 'Tropico 3' and the 'Tropico 3: Absolute Power' expansion.

110649.name: La Guerre des Tuques
110649.description:
La Guerre des Tuques is a team based party game where both team are in the middle of a snowball fight.
The goal of the game is for a team to create the largest Snow Fort while throwing SNOWBALL cards to the other players.
A player losing a snowball fight will receive a WOUND card that will affect him physically during the rest of the game. (example: Must now speak with its teeth clenched). Players that do not obey the wound cards will have their team lose a FORT card to the other team.

Hilarity ensues as the players try to build the biggest fort!

From the publisher. (french version)
Plongez-vous dans l’univers qui a marqué plus d’une génération d’enfants. Cette fois-ci, incarnez un des personnages cultes du film, rassemblez-vous en deux équipes et préparez-vous pour la bataille.

Tous les coups sont permis et les conséquences sont farfelues.

Construisez votre fort pour gagner la Guerre des Tuques.

110650.name: Snood
110650.description:
User Summary:
Snood is a connect-three style puzzle game. Players shoot Snoods from a cannon into an existing tableau of Snoods in an effort to group a minimum of three Snoods together and making them disappear before the ceiling drops down.

110651.name: Rogues and Politicians
110651.description:
From publisher blurb:

The chronies have gathered at Styx for a friendly barbeque. There are burgers, hot dogs, ziti, potato chips, soda, cake, ice-cream, and whatever else the chronies want. Play out this scene for a bit.

Someone will discover (the hard way) that what looks like a whipped cream topping on the cake is actually shaving cream!

Hunter, the spanners’ mentor, is a bit put off by this, but she knew something strange was going to happen today (she knows from a dossier that Tommy arrives today and that the novices meet Helmut at the same time, but she doesn’t know about each of Helmut’s pranks specifically; she guesses that this is Helmut’s doing, but holds that information unavailable until the PCs meet him). She asks the corner to find out who put the shaving cream on the cake. She also says she’s going to make another cake, and asks someone to get some real whipped cream (she specifies Cool Whip).

Hunter declares a rendezvous one minute Up.

110652.name: Identity is All
110652.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventure is designed to be run immediately after character creation as an introductory scenario. It presents an elementary problem-solving situation to the spanners, and does not deal with Time Combat or narcissists or anything complicated like that. Experienced players will have too easy a time of it and will solve the adventure almost immediately. The scenario is supposed to get players thinking four-dimensionally.

This document is not a carefully-detailed adventure; it requires much embellishment by the Game Master. I have not, for instance, provided details of the corner or the chronies. There are some unexplained references in this scenario that assume you’re familiar with central Long Island. These references can be changed to any generic locations that apply. Just about any late twentieth or early twenty-first century corner would do, really.

110653.name: Color Mio Art
110653.description:
UNRELEASED GAME



Note that all details for this game are preliminary. If you have information about this game, you are invited to edit this section or submit corrections.




Here's a short description of ColorMio Art from the designer/publisher:


Open three dye cards.
You can discard all the palette cards that have the colors made by three dye cards after taking one palette card.
Discard one palette card after discarding the used dye cards and making dye cards three cards. After this, your turn is over.
The player who discards all his palette cards becomes a winner.


More details in the wake of Spiel 2011...

110654.name: Mancala: FS5
110654.description:
User Summary

The ancient game of Mancala. Grab pebbles from a well and drop them one by one in the wells to the right. Keeping only what lands in the large pit on the right and whatever you can capture from your opponent's wells.

110655.name: Pyramis
110655.description:
Tiring of stone pyramids and all the work involved with them, Pharaoh the king of Egypt plans to build new pyramids out of gemstone cubes. How colorful, how novel – now you and the other players need to get the work done.

Each round in Pyramis is broken into two parts: the "mining" of gems and the building of pyramids. During the mining phase, players take turns drawing gems from the gembag, pulling 1-3 at a time. If they draw more than the specified amounts shown on that round's king card, then the player must give up that color of cubes along with extras as a penalty. Players can stop drawing gems at any time, and players score points based on the number of gems they draw in a round.

Players then build mini-pyramids of four gems, with more points being scored when the pyramids have fewer colors in them. You must use all of your gems each round, whether to complete pyramids started by others or to leave half-finished pyramids of your own.

After four rounds, the player with the most points wins.

110656.name: Pathology HD
110656.description:
User Summary

Move your ball around the board by placing path tiles in front of it. As space runs out and tiles are shared try to send opponents into the wall while avoiding the same from happening to you.

110657.name: Goldnaire
110657.description:
You are a renowned gold jeweler – a master craftsman – but are you proficient enough to claim the title Goldnaire?

Players start with a hand of six cards, with the cards showing various types of jewelry. On a turn, you lay down 1-2 types of jewelry on the table in front of you, then trade with other players for the cards in their hands while trading away what you hold. After trading, you may lay down additional cards from your hand if they match the two types on the table in front of you.

If you have enough points on the table, you can then trade them in for one or more gold bars from the stack. As the gold bars are claimed, the point value needed to claim more rises.

You can discard cards from your hand, but you receive a penalty point when doing so; alternatively, you can donate cards to other players. At the end of your turn, you refill your hand to six cards.

When the last gold bar is claimed, the game ends. Who will be the Goldnaire?

110663.name: Brass & Steel
110663.description:
Publisher Blurb:
A Game of Steampunk Adventure

Brass & Steel is a hybrid paper and pencil RPG, which blends elements of tabletop and LARP play, and can be used exclusively for either style of gaming, as a given group chooses. The game is set in a version of our own Earth where technology works a bit strangely, and where certain paranormal powers operate as well. Arcanists command elemental forces through willpower and dangerous chemical concoctions, while airships cruise the skies powered by ferociously energetic Hotaether and held aloft by the power of Slack (another technological marvel!) and lucid dreamers explore the mysteries of the dream realms, where they can pluck secrets from the shadows of other's daydreams and imaginations.

The game world itself features a tense geopolitical tussle between two major power blocks, as well as the final and most dangerous phases of European imperialism. Player characters can adventure in the capitals of the great powers, or in cities at the edges of empire, where powers clash and intrigue is never more than a whispered conversation or stolen secret away. Our initial focus is on the city of Constantinople, where the two great alliances jostle for position, and Greeks and Turks alike harbor ambitions and resentments. Also, there are attractive people in goggles.

110669.name: Dracula
110669.description:
From the manual

Objectives
Rise from your coffin and find victims. Bite them for the blood that keeps you going, and return to the graveyard before the dawn! Take the form of a vampire bat to speed through the night, but don't let the vulture carry you away. Take human form to bite and turn your victims into Zombies. Then, make them attack patrolling constables. Flee from the white wolf when you are afoot. Above all, return to the graveyard before daybreak, so you can rise again the next night. Live as long as you are able!

110672.name: Evas Welt
110672.description:
In Evas World there are buildings, a car, a tractor & trailer, a swimming pool, trees, a pasture and much, much more. All those things are pictured on 48 discovery cards, items are presented as seen from all possible directions. On the game board with 12 inner squares all those things are pictured when being looked on from above, as you would do from an airplane.

In your turn you roll and move your marker around the 12 central squares on the board. Then you look at the squares adjacent to the square with your marker and try to imagine how the situation would look if you were standing in the road instead of looking down. Then you take the corresponding pictures from the display of discovery cards. Your left neighbour controls your choice, he can turn over the cards, the correct solution is given on the back. When all discovery cards have been given out, the player with most cards wins.

110674.name: Filly Unicorn Abenteuer auf den Kristallinseln
110674.description: In a display of 8 open cards and a stack you place your filly and then move it around the display for the number given on the top card of the stack. Then you decide on a card in the row with your Filly, you can take the top card from the stack, too. Or you pass. Cards taken are placed in your personal stack, you must not look at the stack during the game. Gaps in the display are filled from the stack. When the stack is finished, your personal stack is scored. You score 1 point, for 2 identical cards, 2 points for 3 or more identical cards, task cards that you can meet score 1 to 3 points depending on the number and kind of symbols. For task cards not met you lose 1 point. You win with the highest score.

110675.name: Filly Unicorn: Das große Regenbogenfest
110675.description: Rainbow island and tower are set up, the crystal meadows laid out and the crystals stacked. In your turn you roll the dice and can jump your filly over a crystal stack showing a crystal of a color rolled, and again for the 2nd die. You can jump from the island on all meadows and from one meadow to the next one or back to the island. If you cannot jump or do not want to take the colors, must discard a crystal. For a set of one crystal in each color you receive a rainbow chip, and you can swap crystals 2:1 with other Fillies. You win with three rainbow chips.

110676.name: Gamebook Adventures 1: An Assassin in Orlandes
110676.description:
Set within Orlandes City itself, nobles are being systematically murdered by a ruthless assassin no-one seems able to catch. Finding yourself thrust in the middle of a large conspiracy, you must make decisions that may put yourself and one other most precious to you in great danger. Can you locate the Assassin in Orlandes before it is too late?

A Newly written story by S.P. Osborne that twists and turns taking the reader on an exciting adventure through the land of Orlandes. We are not simply a re-print of old gamebooks with each GA story lovingly crafted by experienced gamebook authors.

Easy to use interface with classic page turning. As easy as reading a book!
Real-time 3D dice rolling with realistic physics.
Easy to change fonts, font sizes, and paper type to set up the book the way you want it.
Character sheet that tracks your stuff as well as the clues you have found
Use bookmarks to save your progress helping you get past tricky sections.
Dozens of unique achievements to collect.
Beautifully illustrated by Pirkka Harvala. Try to find all of the images in the book!
Interactive world map which can be zoomed and scrolled.

Source: The Developer Website.

110677.name: Wilderness of Mirrors 002 Edition
110677.description:
From publisher blurb:

Was James Bond ever first level? Does Jason Bourne need a Feat to use an automatic weapon? Frustrated by spy games that assume your character needs to go through ten or more levels before he's considered "competent?"

Wilderness of Mirrors is a spy-playing game that turns the very things that make the spy genre work into game mechanics.

'Planning
Players take an active part in designing the adventure with "intelligence reports" that define the mission parameters.

Expertise
No character needs skills or feats to recreate the expertise of your favorite agents.

Trust
When characters betray the group or compromise the mission's security, they are rewarded by the game master.

These and other game mechanics provide you with all the tools you need to play the spy game you've always wanted. Use them alone or patch them on to your favorite game system to give it the spice it so desperately needs.

In a wilderness of mirrors, who can you trust? No-one. Not even yourself.

110678.name: Gamebook Adventures 5: Catacombs of the Undercity
110678.description:
Book 5 in the Gamebook Adventures Series!

Captured by one of Orlandes City’s most infamous brotherhoods, the Red Hand Guild, you are thrown to the mercy of the subterranean world deep beneath the streets of the great capital. Wading through the sewers and other dark menacing places, your goal is to reach Undercity, the City beneath the City! Only there can you find the help you need to escape this underground horror and bring down the dark brotherhood from within.

A newly written story by Andrew Wright, illustrated by Pirkka Harvala.

Easy to use interface with classic page turning. As easy as reading a book!
Real-time 3D dice rolling with realistic physics.
Easy to change fonts, font sizes, and paper type to set up the book the way you want it.
Character sheet that tracks your stuff as well as the clues you have found

Dozens of unique achievements to collect.
Try to find all of the images in the book!

Source: The Publisher Website.

110679.name: Gamebook Adventures 2: The Siege of the Necromancer
110679.description:
Book 2 in the Gamebook Adventure Series

Set in the coastal town of Myr, you have returned home after a long Summer in the mines of Durath Tor to find your hometown besieged by strange creatures. A dark presence has taken over the town and you are the only one who can rid the stronghold of Erid Buul, the mysterious new Lord and his ghastly cohorts.

A newly crafted story by Neil Rennison that twists and turns taking the reader on an exciting adventure through the land of Orlandes. We are not simply a re-print of old gamebooks with each GA story lovingly crafted by experienced gamebook authors.

Easy to use interface with classic page turning. As easy as reading a book!

Dozens of unique achievements to collect.
Beautifully illustrated by Dan Maxwell. Try to find all of the images in the book!
Interactive world map which can be zoomed and scrolled.

Source: The Publisher Website.

110680.description:
"Greek for the holidays" in English
The heart of the game are 55 double-sided cards, thus presenting 110 important phrases, words or questions, specially geared to holiday needs and packed separately in a plastic box for easy transport. A ring-track on the board shows empti spots and spots with city names. Players roll the die and move their token, if it lands on a city name the player can try to translate one card. It the translation is correct he receives one chip. The first player to collect 5 chips wins the game.
110680.name: Griechisch für den Urlaub

110681.name: Gamebook Adventures 3: Slaves of Rema
110681.description:
Book 3 in the Gamebook Adventures series.

Cruelly taken from your homeland of Orlandes, you find yourself in a far off land at the mercy of a gladiatorial arena. Somehow trying to find a way to escape overseas, can you also unravel a potentially dangerous mystery that puts two nations on the brink of war?

A Newly written story by Gaetano Abbondanza that twists and turns taking the reader on an exciting adventure through the southern realms of Rema.

Easy to use interface with classic page turning. As easy as reading a book!
Real-time 3D dice rolling with realistic physics.
Easy to change fonts, font sizes, and paper type to set up the book the way you want it.
Character sheet that tracks your stuff as well as the clues you have found

Dozens of unique achievements to collect.
Beautifully illustrated by Alex Drummond. Try to find all of the images in the book!

Source: The Publisher Website.

110682.name: Gamebook Adventures 4: Revenant Rising
110682.description:
Book 4 in the Gamebook Adventures series.

The mighty city of Falavia, the military backbone of Orlandes, is under attack from an army led by a man claiming to be a God. How did this come to pass you ask yourself? You’re sure it all started as some innocent adventure in search of treasure but somehow it turned into a nightmare. Also, why are people staring at you strangely? It’s not as if you look like you’ve recently been brought back from the dead or something. Oh yes, that’s right. You remember now…

A newly written story by Kieran Coghlana, illustrated by Kyle Ferrin.

Easy to use interface with classic page turning. As easy as reading a book!

Source: The Publisher Website.

110683.name: Hattu Möhrchen?
110683.description: 33 slits in the board carry carrots, one slit is empty. In his move a player pulls out a carrot - if it is good and without worm the player puts in into his rabbit den. A bad carrot with worm goes back into the field in any place chosen by the player. The first player to collect 5 good carrots wins the game. In a variant the board can be turned 90 degrees after each move.

110684.name: Gamebook Adventures 6: The Wizard from Tarnath Tor
110684.description:
Book 6 in the Gamebook Adventure Series.

Two hundred years ago, the legendary City of Tarnath Tor was destroyed as it’s defenders, the mighty wizards valiantly tried to repel an orcun horde. Now just a place set within stories and myths, it has been lost to the outside world. A chance encounter with one who claims to be a time traveller sends you on a mission to recover some magical artifacts. This search will lead you to great ruins and the dark forces who have made it their home. Who is this wizard from Tarnath Tor and how can you trust him?

A newly written story by Al Sander, illustrated by Dan Maxwell.

Easy to use interface with classic page turning. As easy as reading a book!
